Class Converter

java.lang.Object
Converter
public class Converter
extends java.lang.Object
Class which implements functions to convert between Arabic and Roman Numerals.
Author:
Konnor Sommer

    Converter()

  • Method Details

    • ArabicToRoman

      public static java.lang.String ArabicToRoman​(int inputNum)
      Converts an input Arabic number into Roman numerals.
      Parameters:
      inputNum - The input Arabic number, an int
      Returns:
      outString The output Roman numerals, a string

    • RomanToArabic

      public static int RomanToArabic​(java.lang.String inputString)
      Converts an input Roman numeral string to Arabic. Utilizes enum Numerals for making the conversion. Utilizes method Validate() to ensure that the input is valid.
      Parameters:
      inputString - The input Roman Numerals, a string.
      Returns:
      outNum The output Arabic number, an int, or -1 for invalid input.
      See Also:
      Numerals, Validate(int,int)

    • Validate

      private static boolean Validate​(int smallest, int n)
      Class which validates input Roman numerals for method RomantoArabic.
      Parameters:
      smallest - The smallest value of Roman numeral used so far
      n - The value of the current numeral
      Returns:
      valid Boolean indicating whether the Roman numeral is valid
      See Also:
      RomanToArabic(String)
